DataElement.preferredName: Criterion Course Two Allogeneic Hematopoietic Stem Cell Transplantation Fulfill Yes No Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A yes/no indicator to describe whether the patient met criteria to start the second hematopoietic stem cell transplantation.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Criterion Course Two Allogeneic Hematopoietic Stem Cell Transplantation Fulfill
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: That which constitutes a standard from which a judgment can be established, a reference point against which other things can be evaluated, or a basis for comparison._Passage through time; duration; a systematic or/and orderly succession; a sequence, e.g. course of treatment; a mode of action or behavior; natural development, typical manner of proceeding._A natural number greater than 1 and less than 3 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of one and one._A clinical treatment in which hematopoietic stem cells (HSCs) are transferred from one genetically dissimilar individual to another._Satisfy the requirements or expectations of.

Property.preferredName: Course Two Allogeneic Hematopoietic Stem Cell Transplantation Fulfill
Property.preferredDefinition: Passage through time; duration; a systematic or/and orderly succession; a sequence, e.g. course of treatment; a mode of action or behavior; natural development, typical manner of proceeding.:A natural number greater than 1 and less than 3 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of one and one.:A clinical treatment in which hematopoietic stem cells (HSCs) are transferred from one genetically dissimilar individual to another.:Satisfy the requirements or expectations of.

Concepts.definition: Passage through time; duration; a systematic or/and orderly succession; a sequence, e.g. course of treatment; a mode of action or behavior; natural development, typical manner of proceeding.
A natural number greater than 1 and less than 3 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of one and one.
A clinical treatment in which hematopoietic stem cells (HSCs) are transferred from one genetically dissimilar individual to another.
Satisfy the requirements or expectations of.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).
